api/BOOSE.Interpreter.BOOSECanvas.html.title: Class BOOSECanvas | BOOSE Interpreter Documentation
api/BOOSE.Interpreter.BOOSECanvas.html.summary: Class BOOSECanvas Namespace BOOSE.Interpreter Assembly BOOSE.Interpreter.dll Provides a Windows Forms-based implementation of the BOOSE Canvas for graphical drawing operations. Implements the abstract Canvas class with GDI+ rendering capabilities. public class BOOSECanvas : Canvas, ICanvas Inheritance object Canvas BOOSECanvas Implements ICanvas Inherited Members Canvas.background_colour Canvas.Xpos Canvas.Ypos object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors BOOSECanvas() Initializes a new instance of the BOOSECanvas class with a white background. public BOOSECanvas() Properties PenColour Gets or sets the current pen color used for drawing operations. public override object PenColour { get; set; } Property Value object A Color object representing the current drawing color. Setting this property updates both the pen and brush colors. Methods Circle(int, bool) Draws a circle centered at the current cursor position. public override void Circle(int radius, bool filled) Parameters radius int The radius of the circle in pixels. filled bool If true, draws a filled circle; otherwise draws only the outline. Clear() Clears the entire canvas by filling it with the background color. public override void Clear() Remarks This method does not reset the cursor position or drawing color. DrawTo(int, int) Draws a line from the current cursor position to the specified coordinates, then moves the cursor to the end point. public override void DrawTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int The x-coordinate of the line's end point. y int The y-coordinate of the line's end point. MoveTo(int, int) Moves the drawing cursor to the specified coordinates without drawing. public override void MoveTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int The x-coordinate to move to. y int The y-coordinate to move to. Rect(int, int, bool) Draws a rectangle with the current cursor position as the top-left corner. public override void Rect(int width, int height, bool filled) Parameters width int The width of the rectangle in pixels. height int The height of the rectangle in pixels. filled bool If true, draws a filled rectangle; otherwise draws only the outline. Rectangle(int, int, bool) Draws a rectangle with the current cursor position as the top-left corner. This is an alias for the Rect(int, int, bool) method. public override void Rectangle(int width, int height, bool filled) Parameters width int The width of the rectangle in pixels. height int The height of the rectangle in pixels. filled bool If true, draws a filled rectangle; otherwise draws only the outline. Reset() Resets the canvas state to its initial configuration. public override void Reset() Remarks This method resets the cursor position to (0, 0) and sets the drawing color to black (0, 0, 0). It does not clear the canvas content. Set(int, int) Initializes or reinitializes the canvas with the specified dimensions. public override void Set(int width, int height) Parameters width int The width of the canvas in pixels. height int The height of the canvas in pixels. Remarks This method disposes of any existing graphics resources and creates a new bitmap with anti-aliased rendering. The canvas is cleared to the background color and the cursor position is reset to the origin (0, 0). SetColour(int, int, int) Sets the drawing color using RGB values. public override void SetColour(int red, int green, int blue) Parameters red int The red component (0-255). green int The green component (0-255). blue int The blue component (0-255). Remarks This method updates both the pen color (for lines and outlines) and the brush color (for filled shapes and text). Tri(int, int) Draws a triangle with the current cursor position as the top-left corner of its bounding box. public override void Tri(int width, int height) Parameters width int The width of the triangle's bounding box in pixels. height int The height of the triangle's bounding box in pixels. Remarks The triangle is drawn with its apex at the top center and base at the bottom, forming an isosceles triangle. WriteText(string) Writes text at the current cursor position. public override void WriteText(string text) Parameters text string The text string to display on the canvas. Remarks Text is rendered using the Consolas font at size 10 in the current brush color. getBitmap() Gets the underlying bitmap that contains the drawn graphics. public override object getBitmap() Returns object The Bitmap object containing the canvas content, or a 1x1 pixel bitmap if no bitmap exists.

api/BOOSE.Interpreter.BOOSECommandFactor.title: Class BOOSECommandFactory | BOOSE Interpreter Documentation
api/BOOSE.Interpreter.BOOSECommandFactor.summary: Class BOOSECommandFactory Namespace BOOSE.Interpreter Assembly BOOSE.Interpreter.dll Factory class for creating BOOSE command objects from command strings. Extends the base BOOSE.CommandFactory to provide custom command implementations. public class BOOSECommandFactory : CommandFactory, ICommandFactory Inheritance object CommandFactory BOOSECommandFactory Implements ICommandFactory Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks This factory implements the Factory design pattern, allowing for extensible command creation while maintaining compatibility with the base BOOSE command library. Methods MakeCommand(string) Creates a command object from the specified command string. public override ICommand MakeCommand(string commandString) Parameters commandString string The command string to parse and convert into a command object. Returns ICommand An BOOSE.ICommand implementation for the specified command. Returns custom commands for recognized command names, or delegates to the base factory for standard BOOSE commands. Remarks This method checks for custom command implementations (such as "about") before delegating to the base factory for standard BOOSE commands.

api/BOOSE.Interpreter.BOOSEProgramRunner.title: Class BOOSEProgramRunner | BOOSE Interpreter Documentation
api/BOOSE.Interpreter.BOOSEProgramRunner.summary: Class BOOSEProgramRunner Namespace BOOSE.Interpreter Assembly BOOSE.Interpreter.dll Executes BOOSE programs on a specified canvas. public class BOOSEProgramRunner : IProgramRunner Inheritance object BOOSEProgramRunner Implements IProgramRunner Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks This class parses BOOSE program text and executes the commands on the provided canvas. It uses the BOOSECommandFactory to create command objects and handles both parsing and execution errors with appropriate exception handling. Constructors BOOSEProgramRunner(Canvas) Executes BOOSE programs on a specified canvas. public BOOSEProgramRunner(Canvas canvas) Parameters canvas Canvas The canvas on which to execute drawing commands. Remarks This class parses BOOSE program text and executes the commands on the provided canvas. It uses the BOOSECommandFactory to create command objects and handles both parsing and execution errors with appropriate exception handling. Methods ExecuteProgram(string) Parses and executes a BOOSE program on the canvas. public void ExecuteProgram(string programText) Parameters programText string The BOOSE program source code as a string. Remarks This method performs the following steps: Validates that the program text is not null or whitespace. Creates a new stored program and parser with the custom command factory. Parses the program text into executable commands. Executes the parsed program on the canvas. Logs execution status and errors to the debug trace output. Empty or whitespace-only program text is silently ignored without throwing an exception. Exceptions Exception Thrown when a syntax error occurs during parsing. The exception message contains details about the syntax error. Exception Thrown when a runtime error occurs during program execution.

api/BOOSE.Interpreter.Core.BOOSECanvas.h.title: Class BOOSECanvas | BOOSE Interpreter Documentation
api/BOOSE.Interpreter.Core.BOOSECanvas.h.summary: Class BOOSECanvas Namespace BOOSE.Interpreter.Core Assembly BOOSE.Interpreter.dll Provides a Windows Forms-based implementation of the BOOSE Canvas for graphical drawing operations. Implements the abstract Canvas class with GDI+ rendering capabilities. public class BOOSECanvas : Canvas, ICanvas Inheritance object Canvas BOOSECanvas Implements ICanvas Inherited Members Canvas.background_colour Canvas.Xpos Canvas.Ypos object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors BOOSECanvas() Initializes a new instance of the BOOSECanvas class with a white background. public BOOSECanvas() Properties PenColour Gets or sets the current pen color used for drawing operations. public override object PenColour { get; set; } Property Value object A Color object representing the current drawing color. Setting this property updates both the pen and brush colors. Methods Circle(int, bool) Draws a circle centered at the current cursor position. public override void Circle(int radius, bool filled) Parameters radius int The radius of the circle in pixels. filled bool If true, draws a filled circle; otherwise draws only the outline. Clear() Clears the entire canvas by filling it with the background color. public override void Clear() Remarks This method does not reset the cursor position or drawing color. DrawTo(int, int) Draws a line from the current cursor position to the specified coordinates, then moves the cursor to the end point. public override void DrawTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int The x-coordinate of the line's end point. y int The y-coordinate of the line's end point. MoveTo(int, int) Moves the drawing cursor to the specified coordinates without drawing. public override void MoveTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int The x-coordinate to move to. y int The y-coordinate to move to. Rect(int, int, bool) Draws a rectangle with the current cursor position as the top-left corner. public override void Rect(int width, int height, bool filled) Parameters width int The width of the rectangle in pixels. height int The height of the rectangle in pixels. filled bool If true, draws a filled rectangle; otherwise draws only the outline. Rectangle(int, int, bool) Draws a rectangle with the current cursor position as the top-left corner. This is an alias for the Rect(int, int, bool) method. public override void Rectangle(int width, int height, bool filled) Parameters width int The width of the rectangle in pixels. height int The height of the rectangle in pixels. filled bool If true, draws a filled rectangle; otherwise draws only the outline. Reset() Resets the canvas state to its initial configuration. public override void Reset() Remarks This method resets the cursor position to (0, 0) and sets the drawing color to the theme default. It does not clear the canvas content. Set(int, int) Initializes or reinitializes the canvas with the specified dimensions. public override void Set(int width, int height) Parameters width int The width of the canvas in pixels. height int The height of the canvas in pixels. Remarks This method disposes of any existing graphics resources and creates a new bitmap with anti-aliased rendering. The canvas is cleared to the background color and the cursor position is reset to the origin (0, 0). SetColour(int, int, int) Sets the drawing color using RGB values. public override void SetColour(int red, int green, int blue) Parameters red int The red component (0-255). green int The green component (0-255). blue int The blue component (0-255). Remarks This method updates both the pen color (for lines and outlines) and the brush color (for filled shapes and text). SetTheme(bool) Sets the canvas theme (light or dark). public void SetTheme(bool isDarkTheme) Parameters isDarkTheme bool True for dark theme, false for light theme. Tri(int, int) Draws a triangle with the current cursor position as the top-left corner of its bounding box. public override void Tri(int width, int height) Parameters width int The width of the triangle's bounding box in pixels. height int The height of the triangle's bounding box in pixels. Remarks The triangle is drawn with its apex at the top center and base at the bottom, forming an isosceles triangle. WriteText(string) Writes text at the current cursor position. public override void WriteText(string text) Parameters text string The text string to display on the canvas. Remarks Text is rendered using the Consolas font at size 10 in the current brush color. getBitmap() Gets the underlying bitmap that contains the drawn graphics. public override object getBitmap() Returns object The Bitmap object containing the canvas content, or a 1x1 pixel bitmap if no bitmap exists.

api/BOOSE.Interpreter.Core.BOOSEProgramR.title: Class BOOSEProgramRunner | BOOSE Interpreter Documentation
api/BOOSE.Interpreter.Core.BOOSEProgramR.summary: Class BOOSEProgramRunner Namespace BOOSE.Interpreter.Core Assembly BOOSE.Interpreter.dll Executes BOOSE programs on a specified canvas. public class BOOSEProgramRunner : IProgramRunner Inheritance object BOOSEProgramRunner Implements IProgramRunner Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks This class parses BOOSE program text and executes the commands on the provided canvas. It uses the BOOSECommandFactory to create command objects and handles both parsing and execution errors with appropriate exception handling. Constructors BOOSEProgramRunner(Canvas) Executes BOOSE programs on a specified canvas. public BOOSEProgramRunner(Canvas canvas) Parameters canvas Canvas The canvas on which to execute drawing commands. Remarks This class parses BOOSE program text and executes the commands on the provided canvas. It uses the BOOSECommandFactory to create command objects and handles both parsing and execution errors with appropriate exception handling. Methods ExecuteProgram(string) Parses and executes a BOOSE program on the canvas. public void ExecuteProgram(string programText) Parameters programText string The BOOSE program source code as a string. Remarks This method performs the following steps: Validates that the program text is not null or whitespace. Creates a new stored program and parser with the custom command factory. Parses the program text into executable commands. Executes the parsed program on the canvas. Logs execution status and errors to the debug trace output. Empty or whitespace-only program text is silently ignored without throwing an exception. Exceptions Exception Thrown when a syntax error occurs during parsing. The exception message contains details about the syntax error. Exception Thrown when a runtime error occurs during program execution.

api/BOOSE.Interpreter.Core.IProgramRunne.summary: Interface IProgramRunner Namespace BOOSE.Interpreter.Core Assembly BOOSE.Interpreter.dll Defines the contract for executing BOOSE programs. public interface IProgramRunner Remarks This interface provides abstraction for program execution, allowing different implementations of program runners and improving testability through dependency injection. Implementing classes should handle parsing and execution of BOOSE program text. Methods ExecuteProgram(string) Parses and executes a BOOSE program. void ExecuteProgram(string programText) Parameters programText string The BOOSE program source code as a string. Exceptions Exception Thrown when a syntax or runtime error occurs during execution.

docs/getting-started.html.title: Getting Started | BOOSE Interpreter Documentation
docs/getting-started.html.summary: Getting Started This guide will help you get up and running with the BOOSE interpreter. Prerequisites .NET 8.0 SDK or later Visual Studio 2022 or Visual Studio Code (with C# extension) Windows operating system (for Windows Forms UI) Installation Building from Source Clone the repository: git clone <repository-url> cd ase-assignment-davidcralph Restore dependencies: dotnet restore Build the project: dotnet build Run the interpreter: dotnet run --project BOOSE.Interpreter Running Tests To verify your installation, run the unit tests: dotnet test Your First BOOSE Program Let's create a simple BOOSE program that draws a smiley face. Using the GUI Launch the BOOSE Interpreter application Type the following code in the program editor: pen 255,255,0 moveto 200, 200 circle 100 pen 0,0,0 moveto 170, 170 circle 10 moveto 230, 170 circle 10 moveto 150, 230 drawto 250, 230 Click the "Run" button View the output in the canvas area - you should see a yellow smiley face! Understanding the Code pen 255,255,0 - Sets the pen color to yellow (Red=255, Green=255, Blue=0) moveto 200, 200 - Moves the pen to position (200, 200) without drawing circle 100 - Draws a circle with radius 100 at the current position pen 0,0,0 - Changes pen color to black drawto 250, 230 - Draws a line from current position to (250, 230) Loading Example Programs The project includes numerous example programs in the BOOSEexamplePrograms folder: Click File > Open in the BOOSE Interpreter Navigate to BOOSEexamplePrograms/1BasicDrawing/ Select 1unrestrictedDrawing.boose Click Run to execute the program Example Program Categories 1BasicDrawing: Simple drawing commands (moveto, drawto, circle, rect, pen) 2Variables: Integer, real, array, and boolean variables 3IfsAndLoops: If/else statements, while loops, and for loops 4Methods: Method definitions and calls 5miscellaneous: Larger programs demonstrating multiple features Basic BOOSE Syntax Drawing Commands moveto x, y # Move pen to position (x,y) drawto x, y # Draw line to position (x,y) circle radius # Draw circle at current position rect width, height # Draw rectangle at current position pen r, g, b # Set pen color (RGB values 0-255) write "text" # Write text at current position reset # Reset pen to origin (0,0) Variables int myNumber = 42 real price = 19.99 int result result = myNumber * 2 Arrays array int numbers 10 # Declare array of 10 integers poke numbers 0 = 100 # Set element at index 0 to 100 peek value = numbers 0 # Read element at index 0 into variable Control Flow if x > 10 circle 50 else circle 25 end if while count < 5 circle count * 10 count = count + 1 end while for i = 1 to 10 step 2 moveto i * 20, 100 circle 10 end for Methods method int square int num square = num * num end method call square 5 write square Debugging Using the Debug Window Click View > Debug to open the debug window Run your program - execution traces will appear in the debug window Review output to identify syntax errors or runtime issues Common Errors Syntax Error: Unexpected token Check your command spelling and syntax Ensure proper spacing and commas in parameters Verify all control structures have matching end statements Variable not declared Declare variables before using them: int myVar = 0 Check for typos in variable names Index out of bounds Array indices must be within the declared size Arrays are 0-indexed (first element is at index 0) Programmatic Usage You can also use the BOOSE interpreter programmatically in your C# code: using BOOSE.Interpreter; // Create a canvas BOOSECanvas canvas = new(); canvas.Set(400, 400); // Create program runner BOOSEProgramRunner runner = new(canvas); // Execute BOOSE code string program = @" pen 255,0,0 moveto 100,100 circle 50 "; try { runner.ExecuteProgram(program); // Canvas now contains the drawing } catch (Exception ex) { Console.WriteLine($"Error: {ex.Message}"); } Next Steps Now that you have BOOSE running, you can: Explore the example programs to see what's possible Read the Language Reference for detailed syntax documentation Write your own programs to create drawings and learn programming Review the Architecture Guide to understand the interpreter design Run unit tests to see how commands are tested Getting Help If you encounter issues: Check the debug window for detailed error messages Review the example programs for correct syntax Examine the unit tests in BOOSE.Interpreter.Tests Review the project documentation in the docs folder Happy coding with BOOSE!

docs/introduction.html.title: Introduction | BOOSE Interpreter Documentation
docs/introduction.html.summary: Introduction What is BOOSE? BOOSE (Basic Object Orientated Software Engineering) is an educational programming language designed to teach fundamental programming concepts through visual output. BOOSE combines traditional programming constructs like variables, loops, and methods with a simple graphics system that provides immediate visual feedback. Purpose and Design Philosophy BOOSE was created as a learning tool to help students understand core programming concepts in an engaging, visual way. By drawing shapes and graphics, learners can immediately see the results of their code, making abstract programming concepts more concrete and accessible. The language emphasizes: Simplicity: Easy-to-understand syntax with minimal boilerplate Visual Feedback: Every program produces visual output on a canvas Progressive Learning: Start with basic drawing, progress to variables, control flow, and methods Object-Oriented Principles: Commands follow object-oriented design patterns Key Features Drawing Commands BOOSE provides built-in drawing capabilities: Move the pen to any position on the canvas Draw lines, circles, and rectangles Set pen colors using RGB values Write text to the canvas Programming Constructs BOOSE supports standard programming features: Variables: Integer, real, boolean, and array types Expressions: Mathematical operations and comparisons Control Flow: If/else statements, while loops, and for loops Methods: Define reusable functions with parameters and return values Arrays: Fixed-size arrays with poke/peek operations Example Program Here's a simple BOOSE program that draws colored shapes: int radius = 50 int width = 100 pen 0,0,255 moveto 100, 100 circle radius pen 255,0,0 moveto 150, 50 rect width, 100 This program: Declares integer variables for radius and width Sets the pen color to blue (RGB: 0,0,255) Moves to position (100,100) and draws a circle with radius 50 Changes the pen color to red (RGB: 255,0,0) Moves to position (150,50) and draws a 100x100 rectangle Architecture This BOOSE interpreter is built in C# using Windows Forms and follows object-oriented design principles: Command Pattern: Each BOOSE command is implemented as a separate command object Factory Pattern: Commands are created using a factory for flexibility and extensibility Singleton Pattern: Debug window uses singleton pattern for centralized logging Parser: Converts BOOSE source code into executable command objects Canvas: Abstracts graphics operations for drawing output Use Cases BOOSE is ideal for: Learning programming fundamentals in a visual way Teaching object-oriented design patterns Understanding interpreter and compiler construction Practicing software engineering principles (testing, documentation, version control) Experimenting with language design and implementation Project Structure The BOOSE interpreter consists of: BOOSE.Interpreter: Main interpreter implementation with parser, canvas, and UI BOOSE.Interpreter.Tests: Unit tests for commands and interpreter functionality BOOSE.dll: Base library providing core parsing and command infrastructure BOOSEexamplePrograms: Sample programs demonstrating BOOSE features Next Steps Ready to start using BOOSE? Head over to the Getting Started guide to learn how to run your first BOOSE program.
